message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.DS 

The paper presents a novel optimization algorithm for Piecewise-Linear Convolutional Neural Networks (PL-CNNs), which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of an SVM classifier as the final layer, which suggests the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as possible options. Finally, the optimization algorithm is based on a difference-of-convex (DC) program, which is a structured SVM problem, indicating the sub-category cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as a potential fit.
